text: -henge, and also the people of Easter Island are stone-face statues. Haven't moved in a million years. Grim.

name: m1st3rbl4ck
text:
i tell people about scared heart syndrome, and finish by saying, 'trust me, i'm a doctor'.

i'm actually just premed but they believe me...

name: william
text: Alt Text: This is how dudes mourn you if there are no women involved.

name: junko
text: So true.

name: leon_sumbitches
text:
I sure as hell would not go to that asshole's funeral.

but then again, it is their fault he died...

name: dougthehead
text: I would.  It's a golf game!  I think more funerals should include golf games

name: buttermoths
text: Or [url=http://http://m.assetbar.com/achewood/uuafB08d3.com/]bowling![/url]

name: buttermoths
text: NOOOOOOOOOOO

name: scorpio_nadir
text:
Great golf-funeral concept, dougthehead.
The deceased in a casket held above the grave by a forklift with a sensor bullseye on the side. Mourners take turns chipping golf balls at the bullseye to lower the casket into the hole.

This could be a Thing.

name: terribleman
text: I would totally attend. Even if I didn't know the deceased or thought he was a dick.

name: featurelessvoid
text: A comment left by featurelessvoid was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by TonyHighwind, relaxing, equinn2006, nutmeg)

name: stuart
text: I'm pretty sure "spikes" is in reference to cleats. Not a thousand percent, though.

name: thesyndicate88
text: A comment left by thesyndicate88 was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by mjfitzge, Deusoma, cpnglxynchos, usversusthem)

name: nbgreene
text: no, spikes is definitely referring to golf shoes here.

name: chrissketch
text: And collars as in shirt collars.

name: c_dizzle
text:
Huh. I imagined it as animal collars. Silly me.

"Wear a Collar: Spikes Okay." Could be the invitation to a goth party.

name: senseihollywood
text: Golf= so not goth.

name: budenhagen
text: A comment left by budenhagen was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by johnnybaverage, igotnostrings, Deusoma, TonyHighwind, cpnglxynchos)

name: dovey
text:
I don't know. In a lot of situations, the fact that the cast of Achewood are stuffed animals and cats has basically become an afterthought, maintained only for continuity. The concept of the Achewood underground has all but disappeared, for instance, and there's many times where the characters interact (although usually indirectly) with "our" world.

I think as far as the strip is concerned these days, Ray, Beef and the others are just people who look like cats.

name: nbgreene
text:
sorry to put this debate to rest, but i feel like as a golfer it is kind of my duty to explain. many golf clubs do not allow spikes (cleats) on their courses becasue it damages the grass, but some do. it is a pretty common golf phrase to ask "are spikes ok?" and the answer would often be "spikes ok" as part of the golf uniform (which usually includes a collar as well since many clubs require a collar). recently the spikes question doesnt come up as much with the advent and growth in popularity of removable "turf" spikes.

sorry.

name: thesyndicate88
text: Personally, I'm starting to think it's both. Onstad is the kind of classy bastard who would make such a line a double entendre.

name: tonyhighwind
text:
I was tempted to lame you for a second, but my better nature took over.

Do not ever apologize for having terminally pertinent knowledge, I would count it as a favor.

name: scorpio_nadir
text: Yes. You do not wear a Tee on that golf course. You hit your ball off a Tee.

name: numberkillinger
text: could it be a joke based on two possible meanings?

name: numberkillinger
text: to elaborate: It is definitely an excellent joke based on the fact that spikes could refer to their collars or their golf shoes. I will hear no more about it!

text: Booth's foreign policy decisions are often underrated in our present society, I find. His economic policy wasn't quite so good, but overall Booth was one of our finer presidents.

text:

A crown of thorns, and hell of heartburn.

name: curranesque
text: why is Ray wearing a t-shirt in the comfort of his own home? this does not seem like a thing he would do

name: catoblepas
text: Ray using his phone in the most annoying and inconsiderate way possible: the walkie-talkie feature. If there were a vuvuzela function he would probably use it occasionally.
